results.title: Between the wars. - 2.
results.creator_credit: Scott Garen, Anthony Potter, REG and Anthony Potter Productions
results.brief_description: The first SALT talks unfolds the story of the beginning of the arms race between the United States, Great Britain and Japan after the first world war, diplomatic attempts to curb it and the development of the aeroplane as a military weapon. “America in the Pacific”, subtitled “a clash of two cultures” details the increasing suspicion and mistrust between America and Japan and Japan’s rapid rise as an imperialistic military power, culminating in the Russo-Japanese war and the Sino-Japanese conflict. Uses archival footage and interviews with historians. Narrated by Eric Sevareid.

results.title: Bet your life
results.creator_credit: Mike Woolveridge, Don Anderson, Barry Pierce, Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
A 1980 film that encourages safe practices for workers on construction sites. The film presents examples of common factors that lead to industrial accidents, in occupations including electricians, carpenters, metal workers and bricklayers. Opening with scenes of a funeral, and presenting dramatic sequences of each accident, the narrator introduces each character and the careless practices leading to mishaps, dangerous accidents and death.

Produced by the Tasmania Film Corporation for the Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Best horse
results.creator_credit: Stephen Gyllenhaal, Nancy Gregory and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Wendy Herstead, an eager teenager, is sure her beautiful sorrel horse Kick would win the Barrel Race event in the August rodeo, but her mother refuses to allow Wendy to enter. Wendy desperately schemes to raise the money for the entry fees and refuses to believe that Kick really isn’t a good barrel horse. Both mother and daughter learn important lessons about forcing people and animals into undesired roles.

results.title: Best friends
results.creator_credit: Bob Browning, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film portraying the effects of cigarette smoke on the heart and lungs. What the noxious fumes of tobacco do to the defenceless lung tissue shouldn’t happen to an enemy, let alone a friend, as the film convincingly illustrates. For young viewers at an age where they might be enticed to take up smoking.

results.title: Better Wine Enjoyment
results.brief_description: Better Wine Enjoyment By the Experts, takes the viewer to Australia’s most famous vineyards, as well as some of the smaller wineries, seeking out the secrets of good wine from the winemakers themselves. Presented by Collin Segelov, it starts with the history of winemaking in Australia and then moves to the art of growing the fruit and making the wine. Once in a bottle, it proceeds to teach the viewer how to taste, choose, drink and

results.title: Better than sex [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Teplitzky, Frank Cox, Bruna Papandrea and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: Better than sex is a light, playful, Australian comedy of sexual manners which traces the awkward path of a seemingly random one night stand which blossoms into the beginnings of a relationship. David Wenham and Susie Porter star as Josh and Cin respectively, two thirty something professionals who meet at a party one night and decide to have casual sex with each other. Josh has just come back from England and is only in Australia for three more days, which makes the prospect of the sexual encounter developing further, slim. When the one night stand moves onto the second day however, they both begin to question the nature of their apparently casual one night stand. Jonathan Teplitzky uses this mostly two hander as a way to explore the nature of intimacy and the varying differences between the sexes when it comes to love. Cast includes Catherine McClements, Simon Bossell and Kris McQuade.

results.title: Better safe than sorry. - Revised edition
results.brief_description: Depicts situations that children could encounter with strangers, as well as with known adults, that involve physical and sexual abuse and shows children how to deal with these potential situations. Stresses that children are in no way to blame for the deviant behaviour of adults and should not feel guilty about their involvement in these situations. Presents three rules for children to follow: say no; get away; tell someone.

results.title: Berserk 5: Requited desires Ep. 18-21
results.creator_credit: Naohito Takahashi, Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 18-21 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 18 Skullduggery at court threatens Griffith’s life. Ep. 19 Gatsu needs to find his own path which puts him in conflict with Griffith. Ep. 20 Away from battle, Gatsu questions the routes his life has taken. Ep. 21 With Griffith imprisoned for treason, Koska now leads the dispirited Hawks.

results.title: Berserk 2: Immortal soldier Ep. 6-9
results.creator_credit: Naohito Takahashi, Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 6-9 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of black magic and monstrous beasts, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 6: The Band of the Black Hawk has conquered the castle but Gatsu is helpless against Zodd the immortal, an indefatigable enemy. Ep. 7: Due to his band’s brave triumphs, the King honours Griffith who walks freely amid royalty, some of whom seek to undermine his growing invincibility. Ep. 8: Griffith’s ambitions threaten the harmony of his band and his friendship with Gatsu. Once more, The Band of the Black Hawk head into battle. Ep. 9: Skulduggery at court threatens Griffith’s life.

results.title: Berserk 1: War cry Ep. 1-5
results.creator_credit: Naohito Takahashi, Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 1-5 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of black magic and monstrous beasts, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 1: Whilst the King’s merciless rule creates terror amidst the locals, Gatsu slays several of his marauding men, who fear Gatsu’s immense sword. In an attempt to devastate his power, Gatsu challenges the King in battle. Ep. 2: Basuso, a gigantic grey knight, yields terror but Gatsu confronts him. In the woods he encounters The Band of the Hawk - a mercenary army, led by the charismatic Griffith. Ep. 3: Gatsu and Griffith face each other in an almighty showdown. Ep. 4: Gatsu and Griffith develop a friendship; Gatsu experiences flashbacks from his past, including a clash with his father-figure, Gambino. Ep. 5: When The Band of the Hawk attack a castle, Gatsu tries to save Griffith from being killed by a bomb blast.
